title: Train and Distance Problem
problem: A train travels 60 km in the first hour and 90 km in the second hour. If the train continues at the average speed of the first two hours for another 2 hours, how far will it travel in total?
expected_solution: 60 + 90 = 150 km in 2 hours → average speed = 75 km/h → additional 2 hours = 150 km → total = 150 + 150 = 300 km

title: Truth-Teller and Liar
problem: Alice says, 'Bob is lying.' Bob says, 'Both of us are liars.' Who is telling the truth?
expected_solution: If Bob were telling the truth, then he is a liar (contradiction). So Bob is lying. Alice is telling the truth.

title: Bug in Python Loop
Inference from Statement
problem:
If all cats are mammals and some mammals are black, can we conclude that some cats are black?
Note: Base your answer only on the logical structure of the statements, without assuming any additional facts.
expected_solution: No. The statements do not guarantee that any cats are black.

title: Stack Operation Trace
problem: Given the operations: push(1), push(2), pop(), push(3), pop(). What is left on the stack?

title: Simple Sudoku Deduction
problem: In a 3x3 mini-Sudoku, the first row is [1, _, 3], and the second row is [_, 3, 1]. What number must go in the empty cell in the first row?
expected_solution: Only number left is 2 (since 1 and 3 are already present in row).
